Key Match Events: Sherfane Rutherford scored 80 runs off 82 balls with 7 fours and 4 sixes.
Wanindu Hasaranga took 4 wickets for 40 runs in 8 overs.
Maheesh Theekshana was named Player of the Match.
Sri Lanka beat West Indies by 5 wickets.
Charith Asalanka scored an unbeaten 62 off 61 balls.
Post-Match Reflections: Charith Asalanka, the Sri Lankan skipper, expressed that the series win was huge and the team deserved it. He also mentioned the importance of his role batting at number 5.
Shai Hope, the captain of West Indies, reflected on the disappointing performance and emphasized the need to bat better in the Powerplay and play spin better.
Maheesh Theekshana mentioned that he got to play because of the rain and felt lucky. He also discussed the difficulty of playing with the new ball and the ease as the ball gets older.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by rain, leading to a delay in the post-match presentation.
Sri Lanka sealed the three-match ODI series with a game in hand.
West Indies lost their tenth straight ODI in Sri Lanka.
